page.title: 16GAMES WE PLAY
page.content: FIVE STONES. One person throws a ball into the air and tries to pick up a tone and catch the ball before it bounces.If they suceed then they carry on until they have picked up five stones. GRANDMOTHERS FOOTSTEPS. One person has to be on it.They place a stone between their legs and when they turn away you can move towards them.If they turn and look at you then you must not move.If they see you move then you are out. The winner is the person who gets to the stone first. HOP-SCOTCH. The first person throws a stone on to the number one and jumps over it on to number two and then hops over the other numbers and then back again. On the return journey they have to pick up the stone. They keep going until all the numbers have been used.
